ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It did give an opportunity to read some great texts, but I'd tell a student that they'd get almost as much out of those texts just reading on their own.

I would recommend PS 625.01 to a fellow student, especially if they were looking to gain a broad overview of how different thinker in political theory have addressed the question of the relation between means and ends in politics.
Yes, great course, especially as a lead in to the important works that are read in the class (Aristotle, Plato, Arendt, etc.)

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I found a new appreciation for Aristotle, but it was more the reading than the class that did this. Other than that, very little.

Before this class, I never had much of an acquaintance with the works of Gandhi. This course gave me a thorough introduction to his thought, and in all likelihood it will impact my research going forward.
